ajxpcore.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Authentification]
ajxpcore.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Options applied to all auth drivers]

global_param.name: ENABLE_USERS
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Enable Users]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Activate the users management system to protect your Pydio installation.]

global_param.name: CASE_SENSITIVE
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Case Sensitive]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Whether the users identifiers should be case sensitive or not]

global_param.name: ALLOW_GUEST_BROWSING
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Guest Browsing]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Enable the 'guest' user, who does not need to log in.]

global_param.name: PASSWORD_MINLENGTH
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Password length]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Minimum number of characters required for passwords in the application]

global_param.name: SESSION_SET_CREDENTIALS
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Store Credentials in Session]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Set the users credentials in the session after a successful login, this can be necessary when bridging specific auth and access plugins.]

global_param.name: SECURE_LOGIN_FORM
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Secure Login Form]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Raise the security of the login form by disabling autocompletion and remember me feature]

global_param.name: ENABLE_FORGOT_PASSWORD
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Enable Forgot Password]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Add a Forgot Password link at the bottom of the login form]

global_param.name: FORGOT_PASSWORD_ACTION
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Forgot Password Action]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Action to trigger when clicking on Forgot Password]

global_param.name: DISABLE_BRUTE_FORCE_CHECK
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Disable Brute Force Check (Captcha)]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Disable the check of failed login attempts, will disable the Captcha display]

global_param.name: MULTI_MODE
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Mode]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Master/slave will assume that the master is read-only, and the slave is a local alternative to allow sharing features. User Choice will allow the user to manually choose its authentification method at startup.]
CONF_MESSAGE[Create a local copy (at login time) of master users inside slave base]
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Cache master users]
global_param.name: CACHE_MASTER_USERS_TO_SLAVE
MULTI_USER_ID_SEPARATOR
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Separator]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[This is necessary to discriminate users data loaded from various sources. Warning, use foldername compliant characters. For example :: does not work!]

global_param.name: MULTI_MASTER_LABEL
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Master Authentifiaction Label]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Will be shown to the user at login]

global_param.name: MULTI_SLAVE_LABEL
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Slave Authentifiaction Label]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[Will be shown to the user at login]

global_param.name: MULTI_USER_BASE_DRIVER
global_param.label: CONF_MESSAGE[Users Listing]
global_param.description: CONF_MESSAGE[In Master_Slave mode, use this option to limit the users listing in the administration to one driver only (leave empty if you want to see all users)]
